wikipedia_page.main: Harry Windsor-Fry (1862–1947) also known simply as Windsor Fry, was a British painter and educator, active 1884 to 1893.

response: He was born in Wales in 1880 and studied at Lambeth School of Art and Hammersmith School of Art, with Edward Reginald Frampton and Harry Windsor-Fry. Walker immigrated to the United States in 1911, and moved to Northern California by 1913. Initially he settled in Carmel-by-the-Sea, painting and teaching art lessons. In 1914, The New York Times newspaper named Williamson one of a few “notable” artists of Carmel.
